Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Normal & Diagnostic Log Verbosity, at once!" (#1808) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1792

We have a bit of a conundrum: when things break, the diagnostic build
logs are *essential* to tracking down *why* something broke.

However, the sheer *verbosity* of those diagnostic logs makes it
difficult to determine *what* broke; it's very easy to get lost.
Additionally, the gigantic log files make the **Console Output**
Jenkins link nearly useless, as most web browsers will cease up when
attempting to download ~1GB log files.

Split the difference: introduce a new `$(call MSBUILD_BINLOG)` syntax
which creates an [MSBuild binary log][0] file, which is like
diagnostic output *but even moreso*, while *also* overriding the
console logging to `/v:normal`.

[0]: https://github.com/Microsoft/msbuild/wiki/Binary-Log

This should allow the **Console Output** link to be a bit more
reasoanble, and if something goes wrong we can download the separate
`*.binlog` files for further analysis.

MSBuild binary log files can be read with MSBuild itself:

	msbuild /v:diag bin/BuildDebug/msbuild-*.binlog

Note: above command will actually fail; you can only print one log
file at a time with that syntax.

The created log files follow the pattern `msbuild-EPOCH-NAME`, where
EPOCH is the `time_t`/Unix epoch value *at the time the command was
executed*.  This should allow filenames to be non-colliding, and allow
plausibly sane sorting behavior.  (Maybe.)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[monodroid] Include enable_soft_breakpoints conditionally" (#1806) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Noticed the following warning in the build
log. `enable_soft_breakpoints` function is called only when `DEBUG` is
defined. So make sure we don't compile it when `DEBUG` is not defined.

```
jni/monodroid-glue.c(2493,1): warning GF055929C: unused function 'enable_soft_breakpoints' [-Wunused-function] [/Users/rodo/git/xa2/src/monodroid/monodroid.csproj]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Crash on xamarin.android: **conditionidx < t->rows' not met**" (#1807) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Create a new Forms project with F# + .NET standard. Not need the iOS part
2. Add Suave 
3. Apply this code, and run on Oero Emulator:

```
open Xamarin.Forms

open Suave
open Suave.Http
open Suave.Operators
open Suave.Filters
open Suave.Successful
open Suave.Files
open Suave.RequestErrors
open Suave.Logging
open Suave.Utils

module Test =
    let app =
      choose [
          RequestErrors.NOT_FOUND "Not Found"
        ]

    let serverConfig =
        let port = 8080
        { defaultConfig with
            homeFolder = Some __SOURCE_DIRECTORY__
            bindings = [ HttpBinding.createSimple HTTP "127.0.0.1" port ]
            logger = Targets.create Verbose [||]
        }

    let startServer() =
        printfn "%A" serverConfig
        startWebServerAsync defaultConfig app
        |> snd
        |> Async.StartAsTask 
        |> ignore

type App() =
    inherit Application()

    let stack = StackLayout(VerticalOptions = LayoutOptions.Center)
    let label = Label(XAlign = TextAlignment.Center, Text = "Welcome to F# Xamarin.Forms!")
    do
        stack.Children.Add(label)

        Test.startServer()

        base.MainPage <- ContentPage(Content = stack)
```
[sample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2091878/sample.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AXML-Designer broken since VS Update 15.7.3" (#1777) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Create a new Xamarin.Android Project or open an existing one
2.  Try to open an .axml layout file
3. VS is freezing with high CPU Load and is unusable

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

A working Layout-Designer / Sourcecode View

### Actual Behavior

VS is Freezing and unusable

### Version Information

VS 2017 15.7.3
Xamarin 4.10.10.1
Xamarin.Designer 4.12.1
Xamarin.Android SDK 8.3.3.2

### Log: AndroidDesigner-2018-06-01__14-00-02.14800.log

[2018-06-01 14:00:12.9] ERROR: : Couldn't retrieve open document content
System.ArgumentException: bufferAdapter is not a VsTextDocData
   bei Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.Implementation.VsEditorAdaptersFactoryService.GetAdapter(IVsTextBuffer bufferAdapter)
   bei Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.Implementation.VsEditorAdaptersFactoryService.GetDocumentBuffer(IVsTextBuffer bufferAdapter)
   bei Xamarin.VisualStudio.Android.Designer.VisualStudioProjectFile.RetrieveDocument() in E:\A\_work\1\s\Xamarin.Designer.VisualStudio\src\VisualStudio.Android.Designer\VisualStudioFileProvider.cs:Zeile 174.


<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

### Comment

I don't understand how VS on Release channel can be crippled and bugged more and more on every Update (I had to update to 15.7.3 because of the great issue #1651 )?! A Coworker of mine has the same Bug btw. so it's not related specially to my setup.

@ Microsoft: Please get a proper QA-Team checking at least major features of VS before pushing out an update. The Xamarin.Android Layout Designer is a major function used by a lot of people in any edition of VS

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:

2. Paste below this comment block
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[monodroid] Include enable_soft_breakpoints conditionally" (#1806) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Noticed the following warning in the build
log. `enable_soft_breakpoints` function is called only when `DEBUG` is
defined. So make sure we don't compile it when `DEBUG` is not defined.

```
jni/monodroid-glue.c(2493,1): warning GF055929C: unused function 'enable_soft_breakpoints' [-Wunused-function] [/Users/rodo/git/xa2/src/monodroid/monodroid.csproj]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS for Mac Xamarin.Android Archive for Publishing Broken Without Building First" (#1805) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Xamarin.Forms solution that has an Android project.
2. Right click the Android project and choose "Archive for Publishing."
3. Almost immediately a "Package creation failed" error occurs.
4. Workaround: For whatever reason I then attempted building the Android project under the release configuration first, then chose "Archive for Publishing" and then the archive works.

### Expected Behavior
The Android project should create a published archive of the project (.apk)

### Actual Behavior
Package creation fails. 

However, as noted above if you first build the Android project under the release configuration and then choose to "Archive for Publishing" the archive works as expected.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "App crashes on Samsung S8 Android 8.0" (#1803) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Google Play Console reports many crashes of my app running on Samsung S8 / Android 8.0 - this issue only started happening after 30th May 2018.

#### Call stack:
```
00 pc 000000000005beac /system/bin/linker (__dl_syscall+28)
01 pc 00000000000190ab /system/bin/linker (__dl__ZL24debuggerd_signal_handleriP7siginfoPv+642)
02 pc 0000000000130370 /data/app/com.tnemec.mariasek.android-03Z6ZpuZ_a9QKQrb9Lo5kg==/lib/arm/libmonosgen-2.0.so
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Checkout https://github.com/kurtcz/mariasek.git
2. Build Mariasek.Android.Client in RELEASE mode
3. Deploy to Samsung S8 with Android 8.0 Oreo

### Expected Behavior
Application runs normally

### Actual Behavior
Application crashes

A while ago I read about startup time on Xamarin.Android, link to the blog is http://tirania.org/blog/archive/2018/May-18.html (yap, it's Miguel de Icaza's blog), in the blog it says that to remove any dynamic code to integrate with Java Runtime, I don't know much about that but I found this https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/projects/1, is that project related to the blog I mentioned earlier?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "macOS Entry Focused/Unfocused fires immediately with click" (#3012) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When an Entry is clicked, the Focused event is invoked and is immediately followed by the Unfocused event being invoked. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add an Entry to a page and add methods to be called on Focused and Unfocused events of the Entry.
2. Click entry
3. Confirm each event is invoked.

### Expected Behavior
The Focused event should be invoked on first click and when the element was previously focused when the window loses key status and becomes key again.
The Unfocused event should be invoked only when editing has completed, another element / entry gains focus, or when the window loses focus (key status).

### Actual Behavior
The Focused and Unfocused events invoke immediately when the Entry is clicked, and Focused is invoked again once the first character is typed. Neither Focused nor Unfocused get invoked when window focus changes.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 
- Last known good version: NA
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac Version 7.5.2 (build 40)
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
 - macOS: building on 10.13.5 targeting 10.10
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2017, Two Thunderbolt 3 ports)

### Reproduction Link

The effect can be seen in the Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery Entry section

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Macos entry focus unfocus events" (#3011) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Improve the conditions which an Entry's Focused and Unfocused events fire running on macOS. Previously when the Entry element was clicked, the Focused event would be invoked, and immediately be followed by the Unfocused event being invoked. This was a result of the macOS FirstResponder quirks with NSTextField. 

Reference https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/EventOverview/EventHandlingBasics/EventHandlingBasics.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000060i-CH5-SW23 

### Bugs Fixed ###

- Not submitted

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

The Entry element on macOS will no longer invoke Focused and Unfocused events when the Entry is clicked. 

The Entry's Focused event is now invoked only when the element obtains FirstResponder or when the Entry was previously focused when the window lost key status and the window has since regained key status.

The Entry's Unfocused event is now invoked when the native NSTextField's DidEndEditing method is called, or when the window loses key status.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""BackgroundColor = Transparent" does not work for content pages" (#3010) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: In my opinion, it should be possible for us to push pages on the navigation stack with a transparent background. On iOS, it is easy to see that the wrapper controller is being given an explicit White background whereas I can't easily tell how Android's container page/fragment has an opaque background. Transparent pages can be useful for people who want to create popups but also custom page transition animations that do not hide the current/previous page while push/pop operations are being done.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] Setting ListView.ItemSource to null doesn't cause it clear out its contents" (#3008) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Setting the UWP ItemSource to null doesn't clear out the ListView on UWP

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Set the listview ItemSource to something with > 0 items
2. Set the listview ItemSource to null
3.  the items rendered from step 1 will still be present

### Expected Behavior
All items renderered in the ListView should go away when ItemSource is set to null

### Actual Behavior
ViewCells don't go away

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  3.0.0.561731
- Last known good version:  2.5.1.527436 

### Reproduction Link
[UwpToNull.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2091722/UwpToNull.zip)


### Work around
Set the ItemSource to a non null list with zero elements

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Core] Fixed multiple issues with Pickers." (#3007) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Fixes a bunch of known issues with the Picker control.

On of the main problems was trying to sync up SelectedIndex, SelectedItem, and ItemsSource.  What this will mainly do besides the other fixes listed below is to make sure the ItemsSource is no longer in charge of the SelectedIndex/SelectedItem.  There are numerous issues allowing the ItemsSource to control what is selected when the selection is bound but the notorious reseting of the SelectedItem to null is a standout.  Users should expect if the same item is in the list and the list is reset or changed in any way that the SelectedItem should retain its value.

Fixes:

[macOS]
*Fixes issue where drop downs look like they could be selected when there were no items in the list.
*Fixes issue of always showing the first item in the list as selected even though it is not.

[UWP]
*Fixes crash by index not existing in the list.
*Fixes issue of not rendering the correct size if the width was set to auto and not fill.
*Fixes issue of not selecting if the ItemsSource changes (Issue between Items and ItemsSource).

[iOS]
*Fixes an issue where the control text was different from the selected item in the list.  Also correctly resets to blank if no selection.

[Core]
*Removes ItemsSource's ability to reset the SelectedItem.
*Fixes crash on trying to get the SelectedIndex if the Items's collection was locked.
*Fixes ItemsSource nulling out selection.
*Fixes SelectedIndex not tell the respective renderers to update on Items collection changed.

Tests omitted as there have been plenty created at this point through the numerous reports.


### Bugs Fixed ###

There are alot of the same bug opened and too many to really list them all.  I can link them in as I find them all.

### API Changes ###

None.

### Behavioral Changes ###

Pickers should work correctly at this point.  The main difference is the ItemsSource has been removed from parental control on syncing.  We have ran this over our 100's of pickers that are used in different circumstances with changing lists to more properties like SelectedValue which isnt implemented here and all work great at this point.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using ncrunch getting worse since commit "[XamlG] builds incrementally, add MSBuild integration tests (#2825)" " (#3004) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

ncrunch is a popular unit test tool which is not support but does work mainly with Xamarin forms apps as well.

Since this [commit](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/commit/b84b35bb5f36c0a507604100de8a6d754f831668) there is no more possibility to skip XamlC build step (which fails in ncrunch).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a simple Xamarin forms app and add a unittest
2. add something to skip XamlC build step (--> Condition="'$(_XamlCAlreadyExecuted)'!='true'")
3. let ncrunch build the unit tests in you 

### Expected Behavior
XamlC step should be skipped and ncrunch tests run

### Actual Behavior
There is no way to skip the build step and ncrunch is useless (reduced to business logic).
Before we used it in our view models successfully as well.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.530893
- Last known good version: 3.0.0.482510
- IDE: 15.7.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: iOS/Android (unittests)
  - iOS:  nn
  - Android: nn
  - UWP:  nn
- Android Support Library Version: nn
- Nuget Packages: nn
- Affected Devices: all

Problem was removing that from Xamarin.forms.targets file (Line 89-92):
`
<Target Name="XamlC" AfterTargets="AfterCompile" Condition="'$(_XamlCAlreadyExecuted)'!='true'">
		<PropertyGroup>
			<_XamlCAlreadyExecuted>true</_XamlCAlreadyExecuted>
		</PropertyGroup>
`
